grade: Jōyō kanji, taught in junior high
on reading compounds: 付近【フキン】neighbourhood, neighborhood, vicinity, environs, approaching
交附【コウフ】delivery, grant, handing (a ticket) to (a person)
kun reading compounds: 付ける【つける】to attach, to join, to add, to append, to affix, to stick, to glue, to fasten, to sew on, to apply (ointment), to furnish (a house with), to wear, to put on, to keep a diary, to make an entry, to appraise, to set (a price), to allot, to budget, to assign, to bring alongside, to place (under guard or doctor), to follow, to shadow, to load, to give (courage to), to keep (an eye on), to establish (relations or understanding), to turn on (light), to produce flowers, to produce fruit
